protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"47lje","text":"Volpicelli-Daley, L.A., Luk, K.C., and Lee, V.M. (2014). Addition of exogenous alpha-synuclein preformed fibrils to primary neuronal cultures to seed recruitment of endogenous alpha-synuclein to Lewy body and Lewy neurite-like aggregates. Nat Protoc 9, 2135-2146. 10.1038/nprot.2014.143.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":250,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d92m4","text":"Transform Î±-synuclein plasmids (full length human Î±-synuclein cloned into pRK172 vector) into ClearColiTM BL21-competent E. coli, that have been genetically modified so that LPS does not trigger LPS-mediated immune response. From the small scale culture in LB medium, make a bacteria cell stock and keep at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":307,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7vir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fe10n","text":"Prepare starter culture by adding a cell stock to LB medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b97rk","text":"Add starter culture to a large culture medium with ampicillin, followed by incubation   at   with shaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":86,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":91,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d8le1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"946F75E07D4911EC9E91C9CC5A531FD7","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"DCD90EE07D4911EC9E91C9CC5A531FD7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5u3ud","text":"Resuspend the pellet in high-salt buffer (750 mM Nacl, 10 mM Tris (pH 7.6) and 1 mM EDTA with protease inhibitors including 1 mM PMSF.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bj3k","text":"Break the bacterial cells using a high-pressure homogenizer, micro-fluidizer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ja54","text":"Boil for   to precipitate other proteins and then immediately incubate on   to cool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e01if","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"AF3C1E007D4911EC9E91C9CC5A531FD7","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E9487FD07D4911EC9E91C9CC5A531FD7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7pnbl","text":"Spin at 6,000 g for   at   C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8m7ss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"B95060E07D4911EC9E91C9CC5A531FD7","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F3E0E6D07D4911EC9E91C9CC5A531FD7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3c86i","text":"Use the supernatant for further dialysis with 10 mM Tris (pH 7.6), 50 mM NaCl and 1 mM EDTA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blrp3","text":"Concentrate the protein through Amicon Ultra centrifuge filter (100 kDa cutoff).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25kt4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1s96v","text":"Apply protein to a Hi-Trap Q HP anion-exchange column (gradient ranging from 25mM NaCl to 1 M NaCl) and collect fractions, followed by SDS-PAGE and Coomasie staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7slnp","text":"Collect the pure fractions with an appropriate Î±-synuclein bands (~15 kDa) and dialyze with 10 mM Tris (pH 7.6), 25 mM NaCl, and 1 mM EDTA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvd8g","text":"Generate endotoxin-free Î±-synuclein: remove the bacterial endotoxins using Toxineraser endotoxin removal kit (GeneScript), and measure the level of endotoxin using ToxinSensor Chromogenic LAL Endotoxin Assay Kit (GenScript).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39u80","text":"Concentrate the fractions, aliquot, and store at   ÂºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ac1k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0B6A23C07D4A11EC9E91C9CC5A531FD7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of fibrils for neuronal treatment or injection
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ined","text":"NOTE: All the steps here should be done in a fume hood or biosafety cabinet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of fibrils for neuronal treatment or injection
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d5i0o","text":"Thaw sufficient aliquots of 5 mg/mL PFF at   immediately before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1n0bk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F555C26082C111ECBD7E276F666B23D1","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of fibrils for neuronal treatment or injection
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e2u1c","text":"Dilute PFF to 100 Î¼g/mL (for primary neuronal culture experiment) or 2 mg/ml (for intrastriatal injection) by adding PFF to a sterile microcentrifuge tube containing the appropriate volume of sterile PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of fibrils for neuronal treatment or injection
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"92qhv","text":"Seal the microcentrifuge with a parafilm and make a small hole for sonication.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of fibrils for neuronal treatment or injection
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ek1jk","text":"Sonicate (Branson Digital Sonifier SFX 150 from Emerson) at amplitude 20% for a total of 60 pulses (0.5 seconds on/off cycle). Pause briefly between every 10-12 pulses to prevent solution from heating up excessively and to avoid frothing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of fibrils for neuronal treatment or injection
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6q525","text":"Allow sonicated PFF solution to settle for  . PFF suspension is now ready for use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"67f3c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"9307F9D07D4D11ECB15543569CF3869E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"fqvjn","text":"CAUTION: Because of highly neurotoxic and transmission characters of Î±-synuclein (Î±-syn) preformed fibrils (PFF), itâs strongly recommended the use of gloves, face mask, and protective goggles for all procedures involving the use of synuclein fibrils.
